content.question: Which of the following graphs could depict this situation, where time, in hours, is the independent variable, and the volume of water in the pool, in gallons, is the dependent variable?

choices.label: The first segment begins at a point high on the y axis, moves down and to the right a short distance, and ends at a point with an x coordinate of 2. The second segment begins where the first segment ends, at an x coordinate of 2, and is a horizontal segment that ends at a point with an x coordinate of 4. The third segment begins where the second segment ends, at an x coordinate of 4, and moves down and to the right, until the segment ends at the point (10 comma 0). The third segment is steeper than the first segment.

The first segment begins at a point high on the y axis, moves down and to the right a short distance, and ends at a point with an x coordinate of 2. The second segment begins where the first segment ends, at an x coordinate of 2, and is a horizontal segment that ends at a point with an x coordinate of 4. The third segment begins where the second segment ends, at an x coordinate of 4, and moves down and to the right, until the segment ends at the point (6 comma 0). The third segment is steeper than the first segment.

The first segment begins at a point high on the y axis, moves down and to the right about half of the length of the y axis, and ends at a point with an x coordinate of 2. The second segment begins where the first segment ends, at an x coordinate of 2, and is a horizontal segment that ends at a point with an x coordinate of 4. The third segment begins where the second segment ends, at an x coordinate of 4, and moves down and to the right, until the segment ends at the point (6 comma 0). The first segment and the third segment have the same measure of steepness.

The first segment begins at a point high on the y axis, moves down and to the right approximately one third of the length of the y axis, and ends at a point with an x coordinate of 4. The second segment begins where the first segment ends, at an x coordinate of 2, and is a horizontal segment that ends at a point with an x coordinate of 5. The third segment begins where the second segment ends, at an x coordinate of 5, and moves down and to the right, until the segment ends at the point (6 comma 0). The third segment is much steeper than the first segment.
